intro: Micromeria calaminthoides var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are linear and aromatic, with a distinctive scent when crushed. It is part of the Geraniaceae family and is known for its ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
